parameters.name: Category
parameters.description:
The content type of the sensitive data detection rule. Valid values:

*   **0**: keyword
*   **2**: regular expression

parameters.name: ContentCategory
parameters.description: The type of the content in the sensitive data detection rule. Valid values include **1**, **2**, **3**, **4**, and **5**. The value 1 indicates attempts to exploit SQL injections. The value 2 indicates bypass by using SQL injections. The value 3 indicates abuse of stored procedures. The value 4 indicates buffer overflow. The value 5 indicates SQL injections based on errors.

parameters.name: CooperationChannel
parameters.description:
The external cooperation channel. Valid values:

*   DAS
*   YAOCHI

parameters.name: CurrentPage
parameters.description: The page number of the page to return.

parameters.name: CustomType
parameters.description:
The type of the sensitive data detection rule. Valid values:

*   **0**: built-in rule
*   **1**: custom rule

parameters.name: FeatureType
parameters.description: This parameter is deprecated.

parameters.name: GroupId
parameters.description: The parent group type of the rule.

parameters.name: KeywordCompatible
parameters.description:
Specifies whether to allow earlier versions of request parameters to support keywords that are supported in later versions of request parameters. Valid values:

*   **true**: yes
*   **false**: no

> To specify keywords as the content type of the sensitive data detection rule, you can set the Category parameter to 0 for earlier versions of request parameters and set the Category parameter to 5 for later versions of request parameters. You can specify the KeywordCompatible parameter based on your business requirements.

parameters.name: Lang
parameters.description:
The language of the content within the request and response. Valid values:

*   **zh**: Chinese
*   **en**: English

parameters.name: MatchType
parameters.description:
The match type. Valid values:

*   1: rule-based match
*   2: dictionary-based match

parameters.name: Name
parameters.description: The name of the sensitive data detection rule. Fuzzy match is supported.

parameters.name: PageSize
parameters.description: The number of entries to return on each page.

parameters.name: ProductCode
parameters.description: The name of the service to which the data asset belongs. Valid values include **MaxCompute, OSS, ADS, OTS, and RDS**.

parameters.name: ProductId
parameters.description: The ID of the service to which the sensitive data detection rule is applied. Valid values include **1**, **2**, **3**, **4**, and **5**. The value 1 indicates MaxCompute. The value 2 indicates Object Storage Service (OSS). The value 3 indicates AnalyticDB for MySQL. The value 4 indicates Tablestore. The value 5 indicates ApsaraDB RDS.

parameters.name: RiskLevelId
parameters.description:
The sensitivity level of the sensitive data that hits the sensitive data detection rule. Valid values:

*   **1**: N/A, which indicates that no sensitive data is detected.
*   **2**: S1, which indicates the low sensitivity level.
*   **3**: S2, which indicates the medium sensitivity level.
*   **4**: S3, which indicates the high sensitivity level.
*   **5**: S4, which indicates the highest sensitivity level.

parameters.name: RuleType
parameters.description:
The type of the sensitive data detection rule. Valid values:

*   **1**: sensitive data detection rule
*   **2**: audit rule
*   **3**: anomalous event detection rule
*   **99**: custom rule

parameters.name: Simplify
parameters.description:
Specifies whether to query a simplified rule. The simplified rule contains only the rule name. Valid values:

*   true
*   false

parameters.name: Status
parameters.description:
The status of the sensitive data detection rule. Valid values:

*   **1**: enabled
*   **0**: disabled

parameters.name: SupportForm
parameters.description:
The type of the data asset. Valid values:

*   **0**: all data assets
*   **1**: structured data asset
*   **2**: unstructured data asset

> If you set the parameter to 1 or 2, rules that support all data assets and rules that support the queried data asset type are returned.

parameters.name: WarnLevel
parameters.description:
The severity level of the alert. Valid values:

*   **1**: low
*   **2**: medium
*   **3**: high
